Package cryptoTrader.utils

Class BrokerManager

java.lang.Object
cryptoTrader.utils.BrokerManager
public class BrokerManager
extends java.lang.Object
A class used to create and manage several brokers during execution. Also helps to reduce coupling by minimizing direct interaction with the MainUI and individual brokers
Author:
Mitchell Walker

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean addBroker​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String[] coins, java.lang.String strategyName)
    Creates a new broker with the given parameters and adds it to the current brokers
    void clearBrokers()
    used to clear all brokers from the manager to prepare it for the next "perform trade" action
    java.util.ArrayList<Broker> getBrokers()
    Returns a list of all the current brokers
    java.lang.String getBrokerStrategy​(java.lang.String name)
    Gets a reference to the strategy of a given broker
    static BrokerManager getInstance()
    singleton design using lazy instantiation.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static BrokerManager getInstance()
      singleton design using lazy instantiation. Returns a reference to the BrokerManager if it exists. If it doesn't exist it is first initialized and then returned
      Returns:
      a reference to the BrokerManager

    • clearBrokers

      public void clearBrokers()
      used to clear all brokers from the manager to prepare it for the next "perform trade" action

    • addBroker

      public boolean addBroker​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String[] coins, java.lang.String strategyName)
      Creates a new broker with the given parameters and adds it to the current brokers
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the broker to be created
      coins - the list of coins this broker will be interested in
      strategyName - the name of the strategy this broker will employ
      Returns:
      false if the brokers name is already in the current brokers and true otherwise

    • getBrokers

      public java.util.ArrayList<Broker> getBrokers()
      Returns a list of all the current brokers
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all the current brokers in the manager

    • getBrokerStrategy

      public java.lang.String getBrokerStrategy​(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a reference to the strategy of a given broker
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the broker to get the strategy of
      Returns:
      a reference to the strategy of the broker with the given name
